content:
Welcome back to #define, our game of obscure jargon, fake definitions, and expert tomfoolery. This time we're joined by three Changelog++ members, to see who has the best vocabulary and who can trick everyone else into thinking that they do. :link: https://changelog.am/103

38 1:04:39 Closing thoughts (join ++) 01:29
We should totally do a "champion of champions" to see who would win between previous winners :eyes:

Love this show. Listening to round 6 - would I get points for knowing an alternative real definition?

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/WIMP_(computing)
Yeah we’d have to figure something out for that circumstance when more than one valid acronym fits
@Jamie Tanna I literally said the same thing to Jason yesterday! We’ve done 6 of these so we have plenty of winners to face off against each other
It sounds like this game is all still operated via chat, I'm surprised there's not a dedicated web app like the other games you play?
Really weird to hear Myoclonus here - I've heard it medically for a family member but never anywhere else

I personally find the back and forth, the repetition, and the giggling, quite charming and fun
But, I suppose if you wanted to make it more fair:

  • have the definitions read by someone that isn't competing and doesn't know who wrote each definition
  • pass the definitions to text-to-speech
  • pass the definitions through an LLM instructed to make them all sound more like official dictionary definitions (so less eloquent players aren't disadvantaged)
